quote-source: Warsan Shire, â34 Excuses for Why We Failed at Loveâ (via kisstrel)
quote-text:
1. Iâm lonely so I do lonely things
â¨2. Loving you was like going to war; I never came back the same.â¨
3. You hate women, just like your father and his father, so it runs in your blood.â¨
4. I was wandering the derelict car park of your heart looking for a ride home.â¨
5. Youâre a ghost town Iâm too patriotic to leave.â¨
6. I stay because youâre the beginning of the dream I want to remember.â¨
7. I didnât call him back because he likes his girls voiceless.â¨
8. Itâs not that he wants to be a liar; itâs just that he doesnât know the truth.â¨
9. I couldnât love you, you were a small war.â¨
10. We covered the smell of loss with jokes.â¨
11. I didnât want to fail at love like our parents.â¨
12. You made the nomad in me build a house and stay.â¨
13. Iâm not a dog.â¨
14. We were trying to prove our blood wrong.â¨
15. I was still lonely so I did even lonelier things.â¨
16. Yes, Iâm insecure, but so was my mother and her mother.â¨
17. No, he loves me he just makes me cry a lot.â¨
18. He knows all of my secrets and still wants to kiss me.â¨
19. You were too cruel to love for a long time.â¨
20. It just didnât work out.â¨
21. My dad walked out one afternoon and never came back.â¨
22. I canât sleep because I can still taste him in my mouth.â¨
23. I cut him out at the root, he was my favorite tree, rotting, threatening the foundations of my home.
â¨24. The women in my family die waiting.â¨
25. Because I didnât want to die waiting for you.â¨
26. I had to leave, I felt lonely when he held me.â¨
27. Youâre the song I rewind until I know all the words and I feel sick.â¨
28. He sent me a text that said âI love you so bad.â
â¨29. His heart wasnât as beautiful as his smileâ¨
30. We emotionally manipulated one another until we thought it was love. â¨
31. Forgive me, I was lonely so I chose you. â¨
32. Iâm a lover without a lover. â¨
33. Iâm lovely and lonely. â¨
34. I belong deeply to myself .
